0.title: Hong Kong mortuaries run out of space as COVID-19 deaths mount
0.article_body: The mortuaries in Hong Kong ran out of space to store bodies amid a surge in COVID-19 fatalities. According to Tony Ling, head of the city's Public Doctors Association, dozens of bodies are lying at hospitals waiting to be transported to mortuaries. "These bodies now need extra time to wait for collection because resources are just so tight," said Ling.

1.title: It'll be made, it's a dream: Bhushan on Gulshan Kumar biopic with Aamir
1.article_body: T-Series MD Bhushan Kumar said that 'Mogul', a film based on the life of his father and the company's founder Gulshan Kumar, will happen for sure. The biopic will feature Aamir Khan as Gulshan. "It'll be...little later...because Aamir sir's film (Laal Singh Chaddha) has been delayed...I'm in no hurry to make [it]...It's not...project for me, it's a dream," Bhushan said.

2.title: What a blast we had shooting: Shilpa Shetty on 25 yrs of 'Auzaar'
2.article_body: As film 'Auzaar' completed 25 years, actress Shilpa Shetty Kundra recalled working on the project. Taking to Instagram, Shilpa posted a video, which features a few scenes from the movie. She captioned it, "Working with friends never quite felt like work even back then. What a blast we had shooting #Auzaar...with such fabulous co-stars like @beingsalmankhan @sanjaykapoor2500."

3.title: Ukraine demands immediate ceasefire, withdrawal of Russian troops
3.article_body: Ukraine on Monday demanded an immediate ceasefire and withdrawal of the Russian troops from its territories. This comes as a Ukrainian delegation reached Belarusian town of Gomel to hold talks with the Russian counterpart. "The Ukrainian delegation arrived at the Ukrainian-Belarusian border to take part in talks with representatives of the Russian Federation," the Ukrainian presidency said.

4.title: Scientists reveal 4.4 million galaxies via radio telescope
4.article_body: A team of international scientists revealed an "astonishingly detailed" radio image of 4.4 million galaxies through Low Frequency Array (LOFAR), a pan-European radio telescope. The team used algorithms on high-performance computers across Europe to process observations lasting 3,500 hours. This release is only 27 per cent of the entire survey, said Timothy Shimwell of Leiden University.

5.title: Govt revises travel guidelines for Indians being evacuated from Ukraine
5.article_body: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) on Monday revised its international travel advisory, providing certain exemptions to Indians being evacuated from war-hit Ukraine. Mandatory pre-boarding negative RT-PCR test report or full vaccination certificate have been exempted for Indians. Indians have also been exempted from uploading these documents on Air Suvidha portal before departure.

6.title: Salman threw his diary at me when I asked for 'Har Dil Jo...' dates: Sajid
6.article_body: Film producer Sajid Nadiadwala said he and actor Salman Khan got into an argument over dates for the film 'Har Dil Jo Pyar Karega'. Sajid said he told Salman the shooting was to begin in 20 days. "He threw his diary at me...I took diary and adjusted his dates. I cancelled few of his scheduled dates, added mine," he added.

7.title: A movie that slapped patriarchy: Taapsee on two years of 'Thappad'
7.article_body: As film 'Thappad' completed two years, actress Taapsee Pannu shared a post for the film. Sharing a video compilation of several glimpses from the film, Taapsee captioned it, "Celebrating two years of @anubhavsinhaa's Thappad, the movie that confidently called out the flawed societal norms and slapped patriarchy!" Actress Dia Mirza also shared the same video on her Instagram handle.

8.title: Shibani gets wedding date with Farhan tattooed, shares pics
8.article_body: Actress Shibani Dandekar has gotten her wedding date with actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar tattooed on the back of her left forearm in Roman numerals which reads XXI.II.XXII. The couple got married on February 19 at a private ceremony in Khandala. Shibani had gotten Farhan's name tattooed on her neck as a birthday gift to him last year.

9.title: Diljit, Arjun Rampal to star in Honey's film based on true events: Reports
9.article_body: Diljit Dosanjh and Arjun Rampal will reportedly share screen space in an upcoming film, which will be helmed by 'Raat Akeli Hai' director Honey Trehan. According to reports, Diljit will play an activist who'll fight for the victims of the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. It's being jointly produced by Ronnie Screwvala, Honey and Abhishek Chaubey, as per reports.

10.title: Major fire breaks out in Mumbai's Kanjurmarg area, no casualty reported
10.article_body: A "level-2 (major) fire" broke out on Monday afternoon in the NG Royal Park residential building located in Mumbai's Kanjurmarg (East), a fire official said. The fire was confined to the ninth and tenth floors of the building and there was no report of any casualty, the official added. Six fire engines, four jumbo tankers were rushed to the spot.

11.title: India's priority is to evacuate students, our priority is to stop war: Ukraine envoy
11.article_body: India's priority is to evacuate students, our priority is to stop the war and exert pressure on Russia, said Ukraine's Ambassador to India Igor Polikha. He added, "We are requesting all our foreign partners to exert pressure on Russian President Vladimir Putin to stop the war." The government is sending four Union Ministers to Ukraine's neighbouring countries to coordinate evacuation.

12.title: Mamata offers unconditional support to PM on Ukraine crisis, seeks all-party meet
12.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has written to PM Narendra Modi, offering her "unconditional support" amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis. Mamata also requested him to consider convening an all-party meeting. "In times of grave international crisis we keep aside our domestic disagreements to stand united as a nation...India must take lead to offer a peaceful solution to the world," she wrote.

13.title: Thought we'd be saved just like in movies, doesn't seem so now: Indian in Ukraine
13.article_body: Indian student Garima Mishra from UP appealed for help from the Indian government while being stranded amidst war in Ukraine, saying, "We used to see this in movies. We thought we would be saved." She added, "But now it doesn't seem like we will be saved...Please send someone by air to help us. Send the Indian Army."

14.title: Business with Russia means financing Hitler of 21st century: Ukraine Foreign Minister
14.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba took to Twitter to urge countries to cut all business ties with Russia. He wrote, "Making business with Russia today means financing aggression, war crimes, disinformation, cyberattacks and personally the Hitler of the 21st century named Vladimir Putin." The Ukraine-Russia war entered its fifth day today.

15.title: Dynasts can never make India capable: PM Narendra Modi
15.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said dynasts can never make India capable. "Dynasts can never make India capable, they can never make UP capable. Can these dynasts do anything?" PM Modi added. "During the COVID-19 period, they left no stone unturned to hurt the confidence of India. They tried to instigate the poor of the country against the indigenous vaccines," he stated.

16.title: Harshal bowling too many slower balls, Unadkat did the same: Rajkumar Sharma
16.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has said India pacer Harshal Patel is bowling too many slower balls and needs to vary his deliveries. "Jaydev Unadkat was also doing the same, which made him predictable...Harshal needs to mix it up. He bowls the slower one really well," Rajkumar added. Harshal conceded 52 runs in the second Sri Lanka T20I.

17.title: Wrestler Ravi Dahiya wins gold at Yasar Dogu Ranking Series
17.article_body: Tokyo Olympics silver medallist wrestler Ravi Dahiya defeated Uzbekistan's Gulomjon Abdullaev 11-10 in the 61kg final to win gold in Yasar Dogu Ranking Series in Istanbul. Dahiya was trailing 8-10, but stood better in his last move in the final. Dahiya, who won the Olympics silver in men's freestyle 57kg, had lost to Abdullaev in Poland last year.

18.title: Ukrainian children appeal for help in video, say 'We are afraid, we want to live'
18.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share a video of children appealing to foreigners to save their lives in a video amid war with Russia. In the video, the children say that they are afraid and want to live. Russia's attack on Ukraine reached its fifth day today.

19.title: Ukraine man partially sinks Russian boss' ₹59-cr yacht, says 'No regrets' after arrest
19.article_body: A Ukrainian sailor in Spain was arrested after he partially sank his Russian boss' luxury yacht worth €7 million (around ₹59 crore). While he was later released, he said he didn’t regret his actions as his boss was a "criminal who sells weapons that kill the Ukrainian people". His boss had taken over a Russian state-owned weapons supplier in 2016.

20.title: Who is Madhabi Puri Buch, the first-ever woman to head SEBI?
20.article_body: Madhabi Puri Buch has been appointed as the first-ever woman Chairperson of SEBI. She was not only SEBI's first woman whole-time member but also the first person working at SEBI from the private sector. An IIM Ahmedabad alumna, Buch started her career with ICICI Bank, joined Greater Pacific Capital in Singapore and also served at New Development Bank in Shanghai.

21.title: Yami shares pics with kids from 'A Thursday', calls them 'cutest co-actors'
21.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam took to Instagram to share pictures with her children co-actors from the film 'A Thursday'. "Cutest co-actors I ever got to work with...Stepping in Naina's shoes was way more challenging than I had imagined while preparing for the part...But somewhere these little kids came in as a breather," she wrote.

22.title: Rohit is in the XI because of his batting, shouldn't lose focus: Saba
22.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper Saba Karim has said that Rohit Sharma shouldn't lose focus with the bat after being named Team India captain in all formats. "Rohit is in the XI because of his batting. Captaincy is an additional responsibility," he stated. "Lot of times we've seen...captains are not able to perform as well in their primary skill," he added.

23.title: Samantha shares article praising Ukraine President's courage amid invasion
23.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu on Monday took to Instagram to share an article praising Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's courage amid the Russian invasion. The article is titled 'A Prayer for Volodymyr Zelensky' and the excerpt read, "History has found the Ukrainian President and his courage is remarkable to witness." Several pictures of the Russian invasion have surfaced on social media.

24.title: Vidyut to host a show on martial arts, titled 'India's Ultimate Warrior'
24.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal is set to host a reality show exploring martial arts and combat skills, titled 'India's Ultimate Warrior'. The actor, who is trained in Kalaripayattu, an ancient martial art form that originated in Kerala, will find the "ultimate warrior, who has the right blend of physical and mental attributes like focus, control, determination, balance and discipline".

25.title: Virat Kohli should be opening the innings with Rohit Sharma: Hogg
25.article_body: Former Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Virat Kohli should open the innings along with skipper Rohit Sharma for India in the T20Is. "For me, if you're going to have Kohli in the team, he should be opening the batting with Rohit," Hogg stated. As an opener, Kohli has played eight T20I matches for India and has scored 278 runs.

26.title: 64-year-old Delhi man arrested for cheating 60 people of over ₹14 crore
26.article_body: A 64-year-old man has been arrested in Delhi for allegedly cheating over 60 people, including government and public sector employees, of over ₹14 crore by assuring them possession of a flat in a housing project in Greater Noida, police said. The accused, one of the directors of Shubhkamna Buildtech Pvt Ltd, had promised to deliver the project by 2013.

27.title: If Salman hates someone, the person will get to know: Pooja Hegde
27.article_body: Speaking about working with Salman Khan in 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', actress Pooja Hegde said he's a "real person". "He's very sweet...So it's...easy to communicate with someone like that," she added. "What I love about him is that if he loves you...he really does, you can tell that. And if he hates you, you can tell that too," Pooja said.

28.title: Opp'n tried to promote vaccine hesitancy by creating doubts: PM Modi
28.article_body: Opposition tried to promote vaccine hesitancy by creating doubts in the poor people's minds, said Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday. "Those Indians who felt proud by knowing that vaccines were Made in India were incited by the Opposition not to take the doses," PM Modi added. "Even the big countries...are far behind India in vaccination coverage today," he added.

29.title: Marathi actress reveals ATM details to cyber fraudsters, loses ₹1.48 lakh
29.article_body: A 64-year-old Marathi actress was cheated of ₹1.48 lakh after a text message from her telecom operator allegedly asked her to update her know your customer (KYC) details and added that her number will be blocked if she failed to do so. It asked her to reveal her ATM card details after which money from her bank account was withdrawn.

30.title: If they think I'll let down audience, I won't take money: Ronit on TV return
30.article_body: While talking about how one can convince him for a show, Actor Ronit Roy, who will be seen in show 'Swaran Ghar' said he looks for the story, if he finds it interesting and what is his part in the story. "But if they think I'm going to let down my audience, then I won't take the money," he added.

31.title: Bulgarian Defence Minister to be sacked for not calling Russian invasion a war
31.article_body: Bulgaria's Prime Minister Kiril Petkov has said he would sack Defence Minister Stefan Yanev for terming the Russian invasion of Ukraine as an operation and not war. "My Defence Minister cannot use the word 'operation' instead of 'war'. You cannot call it an operation when thousands of soldiers from the one and the other side are already killed," Petkov said.

32.title: Cong's Mekedatu padayatra is for political gains: K'taka CM
32.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said Congress' Mekedatu padayatra (foot march) demanding the implementation of the Mekedatu project across the Cauvery River is for political gains. Congress failed to even make Mekedatu's Detailed Project Report when they were in power, Bommai said. Congress resumed the padayatra on Sunday after temporarily stopping it in January amid rising COVID-19 cases.

33.title: BJP only party to confidently say we did what we promised: Nadda
33.article_body: BJP is the only party that can confidently say we did what we promised, JP Nadda, BJP chief said on Monday. "Earlier, children of poor (people) used to study under a lantern but now they are studying under full bright light as we have given 24 hours electricity," Nadda added while addressing a rally in Machhali Shahar, Jaunpur.

34.title: When I saw Bumrah, I wondered how he could bowl fast with his action: Shami
34.article_body: Talking about his relationship with pacer Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami recalled when he first saw the 28-year-old in the IPL. "It felt a bit strange seeing him because of his bowling action. I wondered how someone could bowl so fast with that action and where he got the power from," stated Shami, adding that Bumrah has "everything" in his bowling.

35.title: Man arrested for selling fake branded clothes in Hyderabad
35.article_body: A man accused of selling counterfeit versions of branded clothes in Hyderabad was arrested by Rachakonda Police on Saturday. The accused, identified as Sandi Satyapal Reddy, was nabbed by Special Operations Team (SOT) in LB Nagar zone. Fake garments worth over ₹2 lakh of brands including Louis Philippe and Allen Solly were also recovered from the accused's possession, police added.

36.title: War doesn't take sides, it causes loss of lives: Iulia on Russia-Ukraine crisis
36.article_body: Actor-model Iulia Vantur took to Instagram Stories to react to the Russia-Ukraine crisis. She wrote, "War does not take sides. It only causes loss of life and suffering." "My heart goes out to innocent lives lost in this war. The only side I am on is that may humanity choose peace against every option possible," she further wrote.

37.title: 'Shri Akhand Path Sahib' recited at Delhi gurdwara for well being of Indians in Ukraine
37.article_body: The Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (DSGMC) organised a 'Shri Akhand Path Sahib' (recital) of Guru Granth Sahib at Gurdwara Bangla Sahib for the well being of Indians stranded in Ukraine. "Government should ensure that our citizens don't face any problem there and they should be brought to India soon," Atma Singh Lubana, Vice President, DSGMC said.

38.title: Pune woman going to office killed after being hit by speeding vehicle
38.article_body: A 24-year-old woman riding a motorcycle was killed after being hit by a speeding vehicle in Pune's Bavdhan, police said. The woman, a resident of Sinhagad Road, was going to her office in Baner on February 25 when the incident took place. She had received major injuries, leading to her death, police added.

39.title: Man out on interim bail in murder case killed in South Delhi
39.article_body: A 28-year-old man, who was out of jail on an interim bail after being involved in a murder case, was shot dead by unidentified assailants in South Delhi on Monday. The deceased, Shivam Pandey, was lodged in the Tihar jail from 2016 to 2020. Police said they got call at 3 am about firing and that several bullets were fired.

40.title: Hrithik & Tiger don't stop practising until they've perfected a step: Dharmesh
40.article_body: Choreographer Dharmesh Yelande has said he really likes Hrithik Roshan and Tiger Shroff in terms of acting and dancing. "I've worked with them, and I've witnessed how particular they're about everything they do. They don't stop practising a particular step until it's perfect," he added. "Be it a hard step or an easy one, they perform everything with...perfection," said Dharmesh.

41.title: Don't want to give details on my wedding, it's nobody's business: Alia
41.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, who's reportedly in a relationship with actor Ranbir Kapoor, said that she likes to keep her private life guarded. "I don't want to give out details of when I'm getting married because it's nobody's business," she added. "But people are speculating and talking about it, now that there is something I can't do much about," Alia said.

42.title: No plans to play Spider-Man again, but no one believes me: Andrew
42.article_body: Actor Andrew Garfield, on being asked if he will portray Spider-Man again, said that there are no plans and "that's the truth". The actor further said, "Everyone's going to call me a liar for the rest of my life. I am the boy who cried wolf now." Andrew had earlier denied his appearance in Tom Holland-starrer 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.

43.title: I just want to see one left-arm bowler in Indian squad for T20 WC: Irfan
43.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said that he wants to see one left-arm fast bowler in the Indian squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "A left-arm bowler and that can be whoever performs in the IPL, Khaleel Ahmed, T Natarajan or Chetan Sakariya...Left is always right," he stated. ICC men's 2022 T20 World Cup will take place in October-November.

44.title: Ukrainians block movement of Russian tanks that stopped to seek directions
44.article_body: Hundreds of unarmed Ukrainian locals surrounded Russian tanks on the outskirts of Koryukivka in Ukraine after the Russian soldiers stopped to ask for directions on Monday. Videos of the incident showed Ukrainian men and women standing in front of the tanks and blocking their movement. A Ukrainian man was earlier filmed trying to block a Russian tank convoy.

45.title: What are the features of 'Mriya', world's largest plane destroyed by Russia in Ukraine?
45.article_body: Ukraine has said that the world's largest plane, Antonov An-225 'Mriya', was destroyed by Russian occupants on an airfield near Kyiv on Sunday. 'Mriya', which means "dream" in Ukrainian, is powered by six turbofan engines, has a wingspan of 290 feet, and a maximum payload weight of 2,50,000 kg. Only one An-225 was ever built by the Kiev-based Antonov company.

46.title: Those who troll on religion are not real Indians: Mohammad Shami
46.article_body: Talking about getting trolled after Pakistan's victory against India in T20 World Cup 2021, pacer Mohammad Shami said, "Those who troll on religion aren't real fans...nor are they real Indians." He added, "If you consider a player as hero and then behave this way...you aren't being an Indian supporter....I feel one shouldn't get hurt by comments made by such people."

47.title: I was advised to get breast implants at 18: Deepika Padukone
47.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone has revealed that the worst advice she ever received was to get breast implants. "I was all of 18 and I often wonder how I had the wisdom to not take it seriously," the actress said. Deepika had recounted this in an earlier interview as well, saying she was told it was the way to get recognised.

48.title: Ukrainian public figures targeted by 'Ghostwriter' hacking group: Meta
48.article_body: The social media accounts of a handful of Ukrainian public figures, including military officials and politicians, were compromised by a hacking group known as 'Ghostwriter', Meta said. The hackers attempted to post videos portraying Ukrainian troops as weakened. It added that it had separately disabled a network of fake accounts, groups and pages across Facebook and Instagram targeting Ukraine.

49.title: Mayank will lead Punjab Kings to successful IPL campaign: Kumble
49.article_body: After Mayank Agarwal was appointed as Punjab Kings captain, head coach Anil Kumble said he believes the opener will lead the franchise to a successful IPL campaign. "He is hardworking, enthusiastic, a team player with all the attributes required of a leader," Kumble added. With 441 runs from 12 matches, Mayank was the second-highest run-scorer for PBKS in IPL 2021.

50.title: Ukrainian woman soldier says 'I'm still alive, everything will be fine'; video viral
50.article_body: A video of a Ukrainian woman soldier has gone viral on social media, where she's saying, "I'm still alive, the sun is shining, the birds are singing...everything will be fine." The woman's identity and the original source of the video are unknown. Several people praised her courage while a tweet also read, "This is simultaneously so beautiful, and just heart-wrenching."

51.title: 42-yr-old tribal man flogged by police in J'khand; CM Soren orders inquiry
51.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren has ordered an inquiry after pictures of a 42-year-old tribal man, who was allegedly flogged by the police in Latehar district for "dropping off Maoists" in the forest area, surfaced on social media. The victim alleged he was beaten till he fell unconscious. "Jharkhand Police, take immediate cognisance of the matter," the CM tweeted.

52.title: How many nuclear weapons does Russia have in comparison to other countries?
52.article_body: As per the data released by the Arms Control Association, a US-based nonpartisan organisation, Russia has the highest number of nuclear weapons at 6,257, followed by the US which has 5,550 of them. They are followed by China (350), France (290), the UK (225), Pakistan (165), India (156), Israel (90) and North Korea (40-50). Notably, Ukraine has no nuclear weapons.

53.title: 10 students from Maharashtra return to Pune from Ukraine
53.article_body: A batch of 10 students stuck in Ukraine returned to Pune by a special Air India flight on Sunday. The students are from different parts of Maharashtra. On reaching Pune, a 20-year-old student said, "We are fortunate enough to come back safely to our country as the third batch of students there are now facing a lot of problems."

54.title: Delhi Police sets up e-kiosk for contactless complaint registration
54.article_body: A digital e-kiosk has been set up at Delhi's Parliament Street police station to improve the interface between the public and the police, officials said on Sunday. The e-kiosk will enable people to easily lodge complaints in a contactless mode, they added. "The kiosk is very easy to access and senior citizens can...use it easily," a senior official said.

55.title: Wanted table reservation, no one knew me; no one had watched my film: Adarsh
55.article_body: 'The White Tiger' actor Adarsh Gourav said he got a "reality check" when he had to reserve a table at restaurant on Valentine's Day. "Every place was booked out...Someone suggested we pull strings...I made calls...and no one had even watched the film. Eventually, one place knew me. They gave me a table, that's because they weren't sold out," he said.

56.title: Irfan Pathan trolls Ravindra Jadeja for blinking too much during press conference
56.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan trolled Ravindra Jadeja for blinking too much during a press conference. Commenting on a video of Jadeja's press conference, Irfan tweeted, "Baapu needs eye drops." Responding to Irfan, Jadeja said that he was wearing lenses for the very first time. Irfan then joked the way he is batting, it seems he is wearing binoculars.

57.title: Latvia allows its citizens to fight in Ukraine amid Russian invasion
57.article_body: Latvian parliament on Monday voted unanimously to allow nationals to fight in Ukraine if willing amid the Russian invasion of the country. "Citizens who want to support Ukraine and...serve there to defend Ukraine's independence and our common security must be able to do so," a Latvian politician said. This comes a day after Latvia shut its airspace to Russian planes.

58.title: Ragpicker killed in Hyd due to chemical explosion in garbage bin
58.article_body: A 40-year-old woman ragpicker was killed due to a chemical explosion while segregating trash at a garbage bin in Hyderabad's Anandnagar on Sunday, police said. "A plastic tin containing unknown chemical exploded...[The deceased's] left hand was severed due to...blast and she died on the spot,” police added. The victim's husband, who was also picking up trash, survived the mishap.

59.title: North Korea says latest missile launch was to test cameras for satellite
59.article_body: North Korea has claimed that its missile launch on Sunday was part of a test for the development of a reconnaissance satellite system. The test helped confirm "the characteristics and working accuracy of a high-definition photographing system, data transmission system and altitude control devices", reported state media. Two photos showing the Korean Peninsula from space were also released.

60.title: SC to hear Cyrus Mistry's appeal to drop its remarks against him in 10 days
60.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's appeal to expunge remarks made against him in the Court's 2021 verdict upholding Mistry's removal from the Tata Sons board. The plea said SC's remarks affect Mistry's "reputation, integrity and character". The Court said it will hear the plea in 10 days.

61.title: PM Modi is born in India to destroy demons, do welfare: Shivraj
61.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi was born in India to "destroy demons and for the welfare of people". "PM Modi...has decided to send four union ministers to ensure that every single Indian is evacuated safely from Ukraine," he said, adding, "It was due to PM Modi that vaccines were made in India."

62.title: We are ready for IPO but the markets aren't: MobiKwik Co-founder
62.article_body: MobiKwik will not be heading for its ₹1,900 crore IPO in this quarter, Co-founder Upasana Taku told Business Insider. Citing the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, Taku said, "I don't think it will be possible for any tech companies to IPO anytime soon." She added, "We're ready. Business performance is strong, SEBI approval is there. But the markets aren't ready."

63.title: Kangana calls herself 'real talent', says 'No mafia can beat honest work'
63.article_body: Rangoli Chandel took to Instagram to share a new still from her sister, Kangana Ranaut's upcoming film, 'Dhaakad'. Sharing the post, Rangoli wrote, "Hope Kangana...breaks her own records with Dhaakad this year." Reacting to it, Kangana wrote on her Instagram Stories, "It's a fight about me versus them. No mafia, no paid PR can beat real talent and honest work."

64.title: Huge traffic at B'luru-Mysuru road due to Cong's Mekedatu rally
64.article_body: As the Karnataka Congress resumed the Mekedatu rally, the Bengaluru-Mysuru road reported traffic congestion and people were advised to avoid the route. The march, which was suspended in January due to a surge in COVID-19 cases, will end at National College Grounds in Bengaluru. It is led by Congress' state chief DK Shivakumar and Leader of Opposition Siddaramaiah.

65.title: Harrison Ford's 'Indiana Jones 5' wraps production, to release in 2023
65.article_body: Harrison Ford-starrer 'Indiana Jones 5' has finished its production, the makers announced on Sunday. The fifth instalment in the 'Indiana Jones' franchise, directed by James Mangold, will also feature Phoebe Waller-Bridge, Thomas Kretschmann, Antonio Banderas and Mads Mikkelsen, among others. The action-adventure film is expected to release on June 30, 2023.

66.title: Why does Russian military equipment in Ukraine have a ‘Z’ symbol on them?
66.article_body: A military source in Ukraine said that the ‘Z’ marking along with other symbols are painted on Russian military vehicles so that they aren't confused with Ukrainian vehicles and the risk of friendly fire is reduced. Military experts also believe the symbols are likely to be connected to the geographic location of where the units would be deployed for combat.

67.title: 3 K'taka hijab case petitioners denied entry in college to attend practical exams
67.article_body: Three students were allegedly denied entry in Government PU College in Karnataka's Udupi to attend practical examinations on Monday. "The lecturer told me she'll accept my practical record book only if I remove my hijab," one of the students alleged. The three Class 12 science students are among six girls who have approached Karnataka High Court over the hijab row.

68.title: Infrastructure is biggest multiplier of investment: PM on PM Gati Shakti
68.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said the PM Gati Shakti initiative will not only lead to rapid infrastructure development but also generate employment. "Infrastructure is the biggest multiplier effect of investment. This also boosts the economic productivity of all other sectors," PM Modi added. Technology will play a major role in PM Gati Shakti, PM Modi stated.

69.title: Neighbours attack man in Guj, ask why he passes by their house daily
69.article_body: A 40-year-old man, Vali Meman, was allegedly attacked by his neighbours while he was out for his morning walk on Saturday in Ahmedabad. Meman said that his neighbour Annu and her son-in-law abused him and asked why he passed by her house every day. He said that his phone was also damaged when he tried to call the police.

70.title: Female Indian students picked up by Russian soldiers: Indian stuck in Ukraine
70.article_body: In a video shared by Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, an Indian student in Ukraine's Kyiv appealed for help, saying, "We've been surrounded from all sides." She said she was told by a friend that Russian soldiers fired at some Indian students who were trying to escape. "They (the soldiers) picked up just the girls," she said.

71.title: Russia further isolated from international financial system, Putin must fail: UK
71.article_body: UK's Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Monday said, "We've further isolated Russia from the international financial system this morning." He added, "Working with our partners, and the G7, we are determined to impose the most severe economic measures possible against Russian President Vladimir Putin for his abhorrent campaign against Ukraine." The UK PM also said, "Putin must fail."

72.title: Dalit RTI activist allegedly beaten, forced to drink urine in MP
72.article_body: Shashikant Jatav, a 33-year-old Dalit Right to Information (RTI) activist, was allegedly beaten up and forced to drink urine by seven people on February 23 in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. He was attacked after he sought information related to the Barhi village panchayat. Jatav was locked up in a room and allegedly thrashed. The accused also made casteist remarks against him.

73.title: Realise the scale of Ukrainian heroism: Ukraine on map comparing Ukraine, Russia's size
73.article_body: Ukraine's official Twitter account shared a map comparing Ukraine's size to Russia's, which read, "Realise the scale of Ukrainian heroism." Ukraine also tweeted, "Don't be afraid to stand up to evil, no matter how powerful it seems, at the dawn, the flag will still be there." Ukraine on Monday said Russian troops have slowed down "the pace of the offensive".

74.title: EU shuts its airspace to Russian planes, to send fighter jets to Ukraine amid war
74.article_body: The European Union has said it will purchase and deliver weapons to Ukraine, while also strengthening sanctions against Russia including closing its airspace to Russian planes and banning state-owned Russian media. The EU countries will also send fighter jets to Ukraine at Kyiv's request to help it counter the Russian air and land assault.

75.title: Old income tax regime with deductions must go: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj
75.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj has said that the old income tax regime must be disincentivised and the new regime must be incentivised with no exemptions. "The new regime will not take over unless we do so," Bajaj said. "What should the simple regime be? The simple regime should be broader tax slabs, lower taxes, no exemptions," he added.

76.title: We have been waiting for 6 years for this trophy: Shaheen on winning PSL 2022
76.article_body: Lahore Qalandars captain Shaheen Afridi thanked the fans and crowd after winning the seventh edition of the PSL on Sunday. "We have been waiting for six years...A lot of people supported me. The fight we showed as a team throughout the tournament is really fantastic," he added. Qalandars defeated Multan Sultans in the final to claim their maiden PSL trophy.

77.title: Norway wealth fund, world's largest, to divest its Russian assets
77.article_body:
Norway's $1.3 trillion sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, will divest its Russian assets following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We have decided to freeze the fund's investments and have begun a process of selling out (of Russia)," Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Støre
 said. Norges Bank Investment Management's (NBIM) Russian assets were worth $2.83 billion at the end of 2021.

78.title: Ukraine sets up 'Come Back Alive' hotline for families of Russian soldiers
78.article_body: Ukraine has set up a hotline for the family members of the Russian soldiers. Called "Come Back Alive from Ukraine", the hotline has reportedly received hundreds of calls since the invasion began. Through this hotline, families can enquire if their relatives are alive, taken prisoner or how can they get the bodies of the deceased ones.

79.title: Madhabi Puri Buch appointed as first woman Chairperson of SEBI
79.article_body: The government on Monday appointed Madhabi Puri Buch as the first woman chairperson of market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for three years. Buch, a former SEBI Whole Time Member, will be replacing Ajay Tyagi whose tenure ends on February 28. Buch, who studied at IIM Ahmedabad, has previously worked at ICICI Bank and Greater Pacific Capital.

80.title: Benfica's Ukrainian footballer Yaremchuk breaks down after getting standing ovation
80.article_body: Portuguese football club Benfica's 26-year-old Ukrainian striker Roman Yaremchuk broke down after receiving a standing ovation from the entire stadium amid war in his home country. Yaremchuk was also handed the captain's armband after he came on to play in 62nd minute of their match against Vitória SC. Benfica shared a video, writing, "United!"

81.title: Non-violence is the only way: Dalai Lama on Russia-Ukraine war
81.article_body: Expressing anguish over war between Russia and Ukraine, Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama on Monday called for peace to prevail. "War is out-dated - non-violence is the only way," he said in a statement on his website. "Our world has become so interdependent that violent conflict between two countries inevitably impacts the rest of the world," he added.

82.title: Russia wants to reach agreement with Ukraine: Russian negotiator
82.article_body: Russia is interested in coming to an agreement that is in the interests of both sides at talks with Ukraine, Russian negotiator Vladimir Medinsky said on Monday. Russia started its "special military operation" in Ukraine on Thursday.  Earlier today, Russian military claimed air superiority in Ukraine and alleged that Ukraine was using civilians as human "shield".

83.title: Till death neither will people of Kashi nor will Kashi leave me: PM Modi
83.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said that neither the people of Kashi nor will Kashi leave him till his death. "When I was publicly wished for my death in Kashi, I felt very happy. Even my fiercest opponents are seeing how much love the people of Kashi have for me," PM Modi added while addressing a public rally in Varanasi.

84.title: Smriti Mandhana, who was hit on the head in warm-up match, cleared for WC
84.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana, who was hit on the head during their first warm-up fixture against South Africa on Sunday, will play in the Women's ODI World Cup 2022 after being cleared of any serious head injury. Mandhana did not feel any concussion symptoms but retired hurt as a precaution, according to the medical staff.

85.title: I would love a character, used mom's make-up to dress like that: Avantika
85.article_body: 'Mithya' actress Avantika Dassani said that she would dress like the character that she loved in childhood. "Every time I would watch a movie and fall in love with a character, I would dress up like that, raiding my parents' closets, getting into my mom's make-up, and getting myself yelled at for the mess that I created," she added.

86.title: Selena trips in her heels at SAG Awards 2022; went on the stage barefoot
86.article_body: Singer-actor Selena Gomez, on Monday, tripped while walking the red carpet at SAG Awards 2022. A video surfaced on the internet in which Selena can be seen tripping in front of photographers in her black high heels. Post the incident, Selena seemingly decided to go barefoot to the stage. After seeing the video, her fans praised Selena for going barefoot.

87.title: It's for safety of your citizens you should vote to stop war: Ukraine as India abstained
87.article_body: After the UNSC voted on draft resolution deploring Russian invasion in Ukraine, Ukraine appeared to refer to India and said, "It's for the safety of your nationals in Ukraine that you should be the first to vote to stop the war." India abstained from voting, saying, it's concerned about the security of the Indian community including Indian students in Ukraine.

88.title: 3 employees of CNG pump in Gurugram hacked to death by armed miscreants
88.article_body: Three employees of a CNG pump in Gurugram's Sector 31 were hacked to death, police said. The deceased, all natives of Uttar Pradesh, were attacked with sharp weapons, police added. Police suspect robbery to be the motive behind the crime. A search has been launched to arrest the miscreants. An FIR is yet to be registered in the matter.

89.title: Russia forced to acknowledge suffering casualties for first time: UK on Ukraine invasion
89.article_body: UK's Ministry of Defence has shared the latest defence intelligence update on Ukraine. "Logistical failures and staunch Ukrainian resistance continue to frustrate the Russian advance," it said. It added, "Despite continued attempts to suppress details of the conflict from the Russian population, the Russian Armed Forces has for the first time been forced to acknowledge suffering casualties."

90.title: Salman Khan fails to perform 'Jumme Ki Raat' step with Pooja, video surfaces
90.article_body: Salman Khan tried to reenact a step from his song 'Jumme Ki Raat' with Pooja Hegde on stage during their Da-bangg tour in Dubai recently. However, he was unable to do the hook step as she was wearing a short bodycon dress. In the original song, which also featured Jacqueline Fernandez, Salman lifted her coat with his teeth and danced.

91.title: Kangana Ranaut's spy thriller 'Dhaakad' to release on May 27
91.article_body: Kangana Ranaut-starrer 'Dhaakad' is set to release in theatres on May 27. "The unstoppable force of #AgentAgni is fast approaching," Kangana wrote while announcing the release date. The spy thriller will hit the screens in four languages, including Hindi, Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam. Directed by Razneesh Ghai, 'Dhaakad' will also feature Arjun Rampal and Divya Dutta.

92.title: Shibani is Farhan's 'problem now', jokes Rhea; shares pic from their wedding
92.article_body: Rhea Chakraborty, on Sunday, shared a picture from Farhan Akhtar and Shibani Dandekar's wedding on her Instagram handle. "Mr and Mrs Akhtar, love is contagious, thank you for spreading so much love," she wrote, adding, "Shibani, you make the most beautiful bride in the world, I love you to moon and back. Farhan, she's your problem now, all the best."

93.title: Anti-war coalition in action: Ukraine Prez after talks with UK, Poland
93.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that an anti-war coalition was coming into action against the "aggressor" Russia after holding talks with UK PM Boris Johnson and Poland President Andrzej Duda. "Agreed on further joint steps to counter the aggressor. Anti-war coalition in action!" tweeted Zelenskyy. Johnson said he would do everything possible to provide defensive aid to Ukraine.

94.title: Maha cyber fraud victim calls helpline, asked to call in office hrs
94.article_body: A 47-year-old farmer from Maharashtra called the national helpline to report a cyber fraud that he was a victim of but was allegedly told to call "during office hours". "I called helpline number 1930 and narrated incident...man on helpline replied...their office was closed...asked me to call next day. I went to the police station the next day," farmer told police.

95.title: Russian troops have slowed down pace of the offensive: Ukraine
95.article_body: The Ukrainian military today said that Russian troops have slowed the pace of the offensive with their assault against Ukraine entering into its fifth day. The Ukrainian military added that Russian troops, however, are still trying to develop success in some areas. Ukraine on Sunday night claimed that it has killed and wounded over 4,300 Russian soldiers.

96.title: Russian central bank raises key interest rate to 20% from 9.5%
96.article_body: The Russian central bank on Monday raised its key interest rate to 20% from 9.5% to counter risks of rouble depreciation and higher inflation. Russia has also ordered companies to sell 80% of their foreign currency revenues. Several other measures were also announced by the bank to support domestic markets amid harsh Western sanctions.

97.title: Pune man gets 15-year jail for raping minor niece for 2 years
97.article_body: A 38-year-old man from Pune was sentenced to 15 years in jail for raping his minor niece for two years, while his wife was found guilty of hiding the crime. The man had offered shelter to the victim and her younger sister after their father died. The younger sister was also reportedly sexually harassed by their cousin.

98.title: Mayank Agarwal appointed captain of Punjab Kings
98.article_body: Mayank Agarwal has officially been named captain of Punjab Kings ahead of IPL 2022. "I've been at Punjab Kings since 2018 and I take a lot of pride in representing this fantastic unit. I'm delighted to be given the opportunity," Agarwal said. He added, "My job would be made easier with...talent we have in the Punjab Kings squad this season."

99.title: BJP workers clash with police in WB's Balurghat amid 12-hr 'bandh' call
99.article_body: BJP workers on Monday clashed with police personnel in West Bengal's Balurghat during protests against alleged violence in the state's civic polls. "Our workers were protesting peacefully, they are beaten up. Police are playing the role of a cadre for TMC, this is against democracy," WB BJP chief, Sukanta Majumdar said. BJP called for a 12-hour statewide bandh today.

100.title: India asks its citizens in Ukraine to move to Western parts as Kyiv lifts weekend curfew
100.article_body: Indian Embassy in Ukraine has asked all Indian students in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv to make their way to the railway station for onward journey to the western parts as weekend curfew has been lifted in Kyiv. "Ukraine Railways is putting special trains for evacuations," the Embassy tweeted. Around 16,000 Indian students are reported to be stranded in war-ridden Ukraine.

101.title: 4 new judges take oath of office in Delhi High Court; strength rises to 34
101.article_body: Delhi High Court Chief Justice DN Patel on Monday administered the oath of office to four new judges of the high court, including a woman. The new judges are Justice Neena Bansal Krishna, Justice Dinesh Kumar Sharma, Justice Anoop Kumar Mendiratta and Justice Sudhir Kumar Jain. The new appointments take the number of judges in Delhi HC to 34.

102.title: Want to go, my family needs me; it's dangerous: Ukraine citizen in India
102.article_body: A citizen of Ukraine in India said that she wants to go to Ukraine capital Kyiv. "I want to go to Kyiv as my family needs me in Ukraine. People can't buy food there as bombing is happening. So a dangerous situation out there," she said. Ukrainian nationals in India are reportedly approaching Ukrainian Embassy in Delhi regarding their families.

103.title: Sunday was tough: Ukraine military amid ‘continuous shelling from Russians’
103.article_body: The General Staff of Ukraine's Armed Forces said that Sunday was difficult for its forces as the Russian military continued "shelling in almost all directions". "The Air Force confronts the aggressor both in the sky and on the ground," it said on Facebook. It added that the Ukrainian forces managed to hold control over the aviation garrison in Vasylkiv.

104.title: RCB don't have batting depth, but bowling department is sensational: Hogg
104.article_body: During a question-answer session, ex-Australia cricketer Brad Hogg was asked about RCB's squad for IPL 2022. He responded, "They don't have that batting depth. They're going in with the same problems they had in the previous years...But their bowling department is sensational." He added, "Having Faf du Plessis with Virat Kohli is a better opening partnership."

105.title: Did riyaaz with him, not a day spent without missing: Sajid's daughter on Wajid
105.article_body: Muskaan Khan, daughter of music composer Sajid Khan, of the duo Sajid-Wajid, said that she used to do "riyaaz" with her late uncle Wajid Khan. "I used to watch...chacha Wajid do so much riyaaz...He had a guitar...and kept composing...I would do riyaaz with Wajid chacha...I don't think there is one day we can spend without missing him," she added.

106.title: Kohli can't be replaced at no. 3, Shreyas can bat at 4 or 5 in T20Is: Gavaskar
106.article_body: After India batter Shreyas Iyer scored 204 runs against Sri Lanka while batting at the number three position, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said Virat Kohli remains irreplaceable at the position and Iyer will have to be slotted in at number four or five along with Suryakumar Yadav. "Top-batting line-up allows you to go in with pure bowlers," he added.

107.title: Indian students harassed by Ukraine soldiers after India abstains from UN vote
107.article_body: Indian students are allegedly harassed and beaten by Ukrainian officials at Poland border. A video shows Ukrainian soldiers firing in the air and forcing Indians back into Ukraine. Some students complained that they were kept in a hostage-like situation in the freezing cold and denied water and food. Notably, India twice abstained from voting at the UN on Ukraine crisis.

108.title: Russian vodka thrown out of several liquor stores in US, Canada; videos surface
108.article_body: Liquor stores across the US and Canada have been throwing out their Russian vodka stocks in a show of protest against Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Several videos of liquor store and bar owners emptying out their bottles and taking stocks off the shelves were widely shared on social media. Government officials in Canada's Ontario directed stores to remove Russian vodka.

109.title: Imposing marriage age on girls might not yield desired results: RSS women wing
109.article_body: RSS' women wing, Rashtriya Sevika Samiti, on Sunday said that girls should marry after getting proper education but suggested that "imposing" a marriage age might not yield desired results. "Such issues are better to be dealt with public awareness and holding wider discussions," Rashtriya Sevika Samiti's Sunila Sohwani said.

110.title: Video shows Indian students being beaten on Ukraine border
110.article_body: A video has been widely shared on social media showing Indian students being beaten on the Ukraine border. In the video, guards in uniforms can be seen manhandling students, including girls. Some students can also be seen screaming while pinned to the ground by the guards. Several Indians stuck in Ukraine have alleged they have been stopped from crossing borders.

111.title: Singer Mika Singh to have a swayamwar on national television: Reports
111.article_body: Singer Mika Singh will reportedly have his swayamwar on national television. According to reports, it'll be aired in a few months and Mika will not actually get married on the show. Instead, he'll only get engaged with the contestant whom he'd find the best. Women from all over the country will be allowed to participate in the swayamwar, reports added.

112.title: Will Smith wins Best Actor at SAG Awards, Jessica Chastain bags Best Actress
112.article_body: Will Smith bagged 'Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Leading Role' at 28th Screen Actors Guild Awards (SAG) for his performance in 'King Richard'. The award for 'Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Leading Role' went to Jessica Chastain for the film 'The Eyes of Tammy Faye'. The ceremony was held in California on February 27.

113.title: Russia's ruble falls 30% against US dollar amid sanctions over Ukraine invasion
113.article_body: Russia's ruble plunged nearly 30% against the dollar on Monday after world powers imposed sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. The ruble was indicated to be down 27% at 114.33 per dollar in offshore trading, according to Bloomberg News. The US and European Union said they would exclude some Russian banks from the international bank payments system SWIFT.

114.title: Heroin worth ₹56 crore seized from South African national at Mumbai airport
114.article_body: The Air Intelligence Unit of Mumbai Customs arrested a South African national for allegedly trying to smuggle eight kilograms of heroin worth ₹56 crore inside his luggage. "The seized NDPS substance...was concealed inside two small trolley bags and a handbag," an official said. The man had arrived at Mumbai airport from Johannesburg via Kigali.

115.title: India to send 4 ministers to Ukraine's neighbouring countries for evacuation of Indians
115.article_body: Union Ministers Hardeep Singh Puri, Jyotiraditya Scindia, Kiren Rijiju and Gen (Retd) VK Singh will be sent to neighbouring countries of Ukraine as Special Envoys of India. They will personally oversee the evacuation of Indians at the border areas. The decision was taken during a high-level meeting chaired by PM Narendra Modi today to discuss the Ukraine crisis.

116.title: ITBP Himveers play volleyball at 15,000 feet in -20°C, video surfaces
116.article_body: Indo-Tibetan Border Police took to Twitter to share a video of the Himveers playing volleyball in snow-clad area of Uttarakhand. "How is the Josh...Very high...Himveers of ITBP playing volleyball at 15,000 feet at a Border Out Post in Uttarakhand...Temperature around is minus 20 degree celsius," ITBP wrote on Twitter. In another video, Himveers can be seen patrolling at 14,000 feet.

117.title: He's selfless, wants each scene to be best: Vaani on Shamshera co-star Ranbir
117.article_body: Vaani Kapoor, sharing her experience of working with Ranbir Kapoor in the upcoming film 'Shamshera', said, "[He's] a pleasure to work with because he brings so much work ethic to the table." "He's...a selfless actor who wants to creatively collaborate so that each scene turns out to be the best," she added. 'Shamshera' is slated to release on July 22.

118.title: Death toll from earthquake in Indonesia reaches 11; rescue op on
118.article_body: The death toll due to the 6.2-magnitude earthquake which struck Indonesia on Friday climbed up to 11 on Sunday after rescuers recovered more bodies. The National Disaster Mitigation Agency spokesperson said that six people died in the Pasaman district, while five in the neighbouring West Pasaman. The rescuers are searching for four villagers that possibly got buried in rubble.

119.title: 7 named in FIR for raising 'Pakistan zindabad' slogans in UP's Prayagraj
119.article_body: Police have booked seven identified persons and several other unidentified people for allegedly raising "Pakistan zindabad" slogans in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. "During preliminary inquiry, it has come to light that the persons named in the FIR are associated with the Samajwadi Party," Handia SHO said. "Police are trying to frame our party workers in false cases," Prayagraj SP chief said.

120.title: Woman scares people with cobra to extract money, police launches hunt
120.article_body: Tamil Nadu police are on a look out for a woman who allegedly scared people with a cobra to extract money from them. The police have filed a suo motu case against the woman after a video of her with cobra reportedly went viral. An officer said woman appeared to be nomad and snake charmer.

121.title: You're using Alia's name for attention: Payal Rohatgi to Kangana
121.article_body: According to the format of 'Lock Upp', actress Payal Rohatgi was given a set of charges, where she was supposed to defend herself. Payal was told by the show's host Kangana Ranaut that she cashes in on others' controversies for the sake of publicity. Reacting to it, Payal said, "I can also say...[You are using] Alia Bhatt's name...for...grabbing attention."

122.title: Australia to send lethal military weapons to help Ukraine in war
122.article_body: The Australian government on Monday announced that it will send lethal military equipment to Ukraine to help the country defend itself against the Russian attack. The details of the equipment consignment were not immediately known. This comes days after the country pledged non-lethal military equipment, medical supplies and financial aid to Ukraine amid the ongoing war.

123.title: 352 civilians including 14 children killed in Ukraine amid Russia's invasion
123.article_body: Ukraine's Health Ministry has informed that 352 civilians, including 14 children, have been killed since the beginning of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Ukraine added that 1,684 people, including 116 children, have been wounded. While Russia claimed that its troops are targeting only Ukrainian military facilities, Ukraine said that Russia was lying about not shelling civilian infrastructure.

124.title: It inspired me a million times: Kili Paul after PM Modi's mention
124.article_body: Instagram sensation Kili Paul, who went viral for lip-syncing to Indian film songs, said it "inspired him a million times" after India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi mentioned him and his sister Neema Paul on his show Mann Ki Baat. Taking to Instagram, Kili Paul wrote, "Thank you, sir @narendramodi. I'm so mind blown to wake up to such beautiful news."

125.title: BJP calls for 12-hr bandh to protest against violence during WB civic polls
125.article_body: The BJP has called for a 12-hour statewide bandh in West Bengal on Monday in protest against alleged rigging and violence during the state’s civic polls. BJP spokesperson Samik Bhattacharya said the shutdown from 6 am to 6 pm will exempt essential services. "The elections have been reduced to a farce by the ruling party miscreants,"  Bhattacharya added.

126.title: Samson obviously hasn't grabbed his opportunities: Jaffer
126.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said he feels sad to see Sanju Samson not "grabbing his opportunities" in the three-match T20I series against Sri Lanka. "Samson does show the glimpse of what he can do but just doesn't take the opportunity that other guys have taken," Jaffer added. Samson batted in the final two T20Is and scored 39(25) and 18(12).

127.title: 66-year-old surgeon shot at in UP's Bareilly, one detained
127.article_body: One person was detained after a 66-year-old surgeon and the chancellor of a private university was allegedly shot at while he was returning home from his hospital in Bareilly on Saturday. The victim, Dr Keshav Kumar Agarwal, had stopped at a temple on his way home when he was attacked by a group of men, according to the police.

128.title: Whom did Rohit Sharma give the trophy just after winning the T20I series against SL?
128.article_body: Just after collecting the trophy after winning the T20I series against Sri Lanka, India captain Rohit Sharma handed over the trophy to Jaydev Shah and asked him to join the players for a group photo. Jaydev was the BCCI representative for the series. He is the former captain of Saurashtra and son of former BCCI Secretary Niranjan Shah.

129.title: 22-year-old Delhi man stabbed to death by friend over 'fancy, expensive' knife
129.article_body: A 22-year-old Delhi man was stabbed to death by one of his friends after he went to meet them for drinks. The accused revealed he was jealous of him as the latter had bought an "expensive and fancy knife", police said. He wanted the knife for himself and had asked the victim to lend it to him, but was refused.

130.title: Zirakpur-based realtor held for abducting workmate, snatching jewellery & cash
130.article_body: Police arrested a Zirakpur-based property dealer for abducting his workmate and snatching jewellery worth ₹2.5 lakh and ₹40,000 cash from his wife. Demanding money, the accused made the victim call his wife and threatened her with dire consequences if she didn’t show up soon. Later, they snatched her jewellery and cash, handed off her husband and escaped.

131.title: Bengaluru man gets 6 months imprisonment 19 yrs after causing accident
131.article_body: A truck driver from Bengaluru, Narayana Swamy, has been given six months of imprisonment for causing a fatal accident 19 years ago. He has been sent to Bengaluru Central Prison. The accident had taken place on March 24, 2003 when Swamy had mowed down a 60-year-old pedestrian, Rangaiah Naidu, near Seeta Circle, Banashankari III Stage.

132.title: UN General Assembly to hold emergency session over Ukraine in New York today
132.article_body: An emergency special session of the United Nations General Assembly will be held to discuss Russia's attack on Ukraine at UN Headquarters in New York today. Abdulla Shahid, President of the 76th session of the UN General Assembly, will preside over the session. Notably, the UN Security Council called for the emergency special session for the first time since 1982.

133.title: The real challenge for OTT is to keep the quality up: Shweta Tripathi
133.article_body: Actress Shweta Tripathi Sharma has said the "real challenge" for OTT platforms is to "keep the quality up, especially at a time when so many people are entering this space". The actress, who was part of shows like 'Mirzapur' and 'Yeh Kaali Kaali Ankhein', added, "Quality is the most important thing, no matter what the project or the platform is."

134.title: Kerala eases COVID-19 curbs; allows 100% occupancy in theatres, restaurants
134.article_body: Amid declining COVID-19 cases, the Kerala government has eased certain restrictions in the state. Hotels, bars, restaurants and theatres in Kerala are now allowed to operate at 100% seating capacity, state CMO stated. A maximum of 1,500 people, with one person in a 25-square-foot area, are allowed for public functions. All offices can hold meetings or training offline, as required.

135.title: We’ve been brothers for centuries: Russian billionaires want war to end
135.article_body: Russian billionaires Mikhail Fridman and Oleg Deripaska have called for an end to the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. Fridman, who was born and raised in Ukraine, said that the conflict will cost lives and "damage two nations who have been brothers for hundreds of years". Deripaska said that peace talks should begin as fast as possible.

136.title: Once drugs enter your life, darkness envelops you: Hyderabad Police
136.article_body: Commissioner of Police of Cyberabad, M Stephen Raveendra, took to Twitter to share post to raise awareness about use of narcotics. "Drugs-Darkness, two very close words...Once drugs enter your life, darkness envelops you...Parents and educators, who are the gurus of the youth, should work towards raising awareness on drugs," he wrote, while also using hashtag "Say no to drugs".

137.title: Sensex drops 1,000 points, Nifty below 16,400 amid Russia-Ukraine war
137.article_body: Sensex fell more than 1,000 points to trade at around 54,850, while Nifty dropped over 280 points to 16,378. This comes amid the Russia-Ukraine war. Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday ordered nuclear forces to be put on high alert. Other Asian markets also plunged, with Japan's Nikkei falling 0.34% and Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index falling 1.49%.

138.title: Staying unbeaten commendable performance from my side: Shreyas
138.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer, who smashed three consecutive fifties and remained unbeaten in all three T20Is against Sri Lanka, has said it was a "commendable performance" from his side but he's not keeping any expectations. "I cannot talk about cementing my place, competition is so much, you need to be flexible in batting at any position," he added.

139.title: Shaheen hugs and lifts losing captain Rizwan minutes after winning PSL final, pics viral
139.article_body: Lahore Qalandars captain Shaheen Afridi hugged and lifted Multan Sultans captain Muhammad Rizwan minutes after leading the Lahore-based franchise to their first-ever Pakistan Super League (PSL) victory. "This is beautiful," a fan commented on the picture. Another fan commented, "No one can match the class of Rizwan." Another tweet read, "This is the beauty of cricket."

140.title: 2 empty bullet shells found in bus ferrying Sri Lanka cricketers in Chandigarh
140.article_body: The Chandigarh Police found two empty bullet shells from a private bus ferrying Sri Lanka cricketers staying at The Lalit hotel in Chandigarh's IT park.  The shells were found when players were about to board the bus from the hotel. "The shells were found in the luggage compartment...The bus driver is being questioned," a police officer said.

141.title: We, as Indians, love to work overtime and compare pain with others: Esha
141.article_body: Actress Esha Gupta said that she hopes that the world becomes more empathetic towards others especially after the pandemic. "We, as Indians, love to work overtime and work through the pain...We love to show we can work through crises and compare our pain with others, which is wrong," she said, adding, "We don't need to be proud about slogging ourselves."

142.title: India's daily COVID-19 cases fall below 10,000-mark; 8,013 cases, 119 deaths reported
142.article_body: India has reported 8,013 new COVID-19 cases and 119 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 10,273 cases and 243 deaths. The COVID-19 daily positivity rate stands at 1.11% in the country, while the active caseload declined to 1,02,601.

143.title: Brazil Prez won’t pick sides, says Putin doesn’t want massacre
143.article_body: Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro on Sunday said that he will remain neutral in the Russia-Ukraine conflict. "We will not take sides, we will continue being neutral and help with whatever is possible," he said. Refusing to condemn Russian President Vladimir Putin, Bolsonaro said, "A chief of state like that of Russia does not want to undertake a massacre, anywhere."

144.title: Plan was to give Bishnoi, Kuldeep match practice, that's why I didn't bowl: Jadeja
144.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja, who picked a wicket each in the first two T20Is against Sri Lanka but didn't bowl in the final match, has said that the plan was to give Ravi Bishnoi and Kuldeep Yadav some match practice. Bishnoi picked a wicket while Kuldeep went wicketless in the game. Jadeja remained unbeaten at 22 to help India win.

145.title: Kharkiv governor shares pics of Russian soldiers who surrendered, calls them 'Clueless'
145.article_body: Kharkiv governor Oleh Synyehubov took to Facebook to share pictures of Russian soldiers who surrendered in Ukraine's second largest city. Claiming the Russian soldiers are clueless, Synyehubov said, "They have no connection with central command, they don't understand and don't know their further actions." He further wrote, "Since the beginning of the attack on Ukraine, they haven't received food."

146.title: It's been 3 yrs, haven't been paid for 'Dastaan-E-Mohabbat...': Sonarika
146.article_body: Actress Sonarika Bhadoria has claimed it's been three years but her dues for 'Dastaan-E-Mohabbat: Salim Anarkali', that aired in 2018, have not been cleared till now. "Not only mine but...dues of several other...actors and technicians from show are not paid. It was my worst time. Everything from my end in terms of legal formalities and paperwork is done," she added.

147.title: It made me the 'abba dabba jabba' girl: Upasana on 25 yrs of 'Judaai'
147.article_body: As 'Judaai' completed 25 years on Monday, actress Upasana Singh spoke about the romantic comedy film and said, "I played...a mother and mute woman, who just says 'abba dabba jabba'." "I wasn't convinced about it, but went with...director's conviction...And it clicked! It made me...'abba dabba jabba' girl," she added. Upasana said she's now making a film titled, 'Abba Dabba Jabba'.

148.title: Haryana officials get nearly 1,000 evacuation requests from Ukraine
148.article_body: Officials in Haryana have received nearly 1,000 requests from war-hit Ukraine for evacuation. Reports said that the requests were received from state residents, mostly students. The requests have come in through emails or messages at the helpline number introduced by the state government. Haryana officials have estimated that nearly 1,800 students from the state are stuck in Ukraine.

149.title: Crime rate reduced in UP during past 5 yrs under CM Yogi-led govt: Amit Shah
149.article_body: Union Home Minister and senior BJP leader Amit Shah said that the crime rate has reduced in Uttar Pradesh during the past five years under the leadership of CM Yogi Adityanath. "UP has recorded a decline of 70% in dacoity, 29% in murders, 69% in looting and 52% in rapes in the state under CM Yogi-led government," Shah added.

150.title: 21 school students stung by bees while trekking near Pune's Amba-Ambika caves
150.article_body: As many as 21 school students were hospitalised after being attacked by a swarm of bees while trekking near Amba-Ambika caves in Pune's Junnar, an official said. "Six of the students were in a somewhat critical state due to drop in blood pressure. All are stable now," said a toxinologist from a nursing home, where the students are being treated.

151.title: Planning to provide employment to at least one person of every family: UP CM
151.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said BJP in the state is planning to provide government jobs, employment or self-employment opportunities to at least one person of every family in the next five years. CM Yogi was addressing a public rally on Sunday in Chauri Chaura, Gorakhpur. Polling for the fifth phase of UP Assembly elections concluded yesterday.

152.title: SDMC to build replicas of 15 dinosaurs using scrap at Sarai Kale Khan park
152.article_body: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation is planning to build replicas of 15 dinosaurs out of scrap material at a park in Sarai Kale Khan. The park already features replicas of the wonders of the world such as Taj Mahal, Eiffel Tower and Statue of Liberty created using waste material. The SDMC expects the revenue to increase up to ₹15 crore.

153.title: I would never say no: Sanya Malhotra on working with Shah Rukh Khan
153.article_body: Actress Sanya Malhotra spoke about actor Shah Rukh Khan producing 'Love Hostel'. She said, "It gives you confidence because he is King Khan as we all know him and he knows his scripts and the work that he does." When asked if she'd like to work with Shah Rukh in future, Sanya said, "I'm ready...I'd never say no."

154.title: Important to tell guys not worry about position in team: Rohit Sharma
154.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has said he wanted to understand the team's bench strength in the T20Is against Sri Lanka. "Good to give opportunities to those guys...[but it's] important to tell guys not to worry about your positions. I want to fill whatever gaps we have," he added. India made four changes to their playing XI for the third T20I.

155.title: Drunk couple on honeymoon booked for creating ruckus near Mumbai airport
155.article_body: A newly-married couple on their honeymoon was arrested for allegedly creating ruckus outside a five-star hotel near Mumbai airport. A police constable said they were screaming and fighting amongst themselves in an inebriated state because the woman wanted to go to a nightclub and her husband refused. The woman also allegedly engaged in a scuffle with the constable.

156.title: Belarus revokes non-nuclear status, paving way for Russia to place nuclear weapons in country
156.article_body: Ukraine's neighbour Belarus has passed a constitutional referendum revoking its non-nuclear status, paving way for Russian nuclear weapons to be placed in the country. "If you (the West) transfer nuclear weapons to Poland or Lithuania, to our borders, then I will turn to Putin to return the nuclear weapons that I gave away without any conditions," President Alexander Lukashenko said.

157.title: Chose to switch career, didn't go down well with her: Siddhant on breakup
157.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said that he had a "major heartbreak" in his 20s. "I had clarity when I was 20...I was with this girl for four years...wanted to settle down with her...but then I chose to switch my career. That didn't go down well with her...had to choose between love and ambition. And I chose ambition," he said.

158.title: 4 live bullets found in man's baggage at Delhi airport; arrested
158.article_body: Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel on Sunday apprehended a passenger with four live bullets at Indira Gandhi International Airport in New Delhi. During the security check at Terminal 3 of IGI Airport, CISF found four live rounds of .32 mm calibre from the hand baggage of the passenger, identified as Kapil Vaish, who was bound for San Francisco.

159.title: Shreyas Iyer breaks record for scoring most runs in a 3-match T20I series for India
159.article_body: Team India batter Shreyas Iyer has broken the record for scoring most runs in a three-match T20I series for India. The 27-year-old scored 204 runs in the recently-concluded three-match T20I series against Sri Lanka. The previous record was held by Virat Kohli, who had scored 199 runs against Australia in 2016.

160.title: Chandigarh Airport likely to start direct flight to London by October
160.article_body: The Chandigarh International Airport is likely to start a direct flight to London by October. "The authorities had meeting with the British High Commission...Proposals have been sent...The direct flight will most likely be to the Heathrow Airport in London or Birmingham airport, which is around 170 km from the UK capital," said Chief Executive Officer of Chandigarh International Airport Limited.

161.title: Pulse polio drive begins in Pune; around 2.69 lakh vaccinated on first day
161.article_body: A pulse polio drive was started in Pune on Sunday with over around 2.69 children getting vaccinated on the first day of the campaign. PMC said it set up 1,425 booths across the city and engaged 4,180 employees for the purpose. "For the next five days we will have multiple teams conduct door-to-door vaccination drives," said a PMC official.

162.title: Voting in 38 seats underway in 1st phase of Manipur Assembly elections
162.article_body: The first phase of polling for the two-part Manipur Assembly elections began amid tight security at 7 am on Monday in 38 constituencies across five districts. As many as 173 candidates in the state are in the fray. According to state Chief Electoral Officer Rajesh Agrawal, 12,09,439 voters are expected to exercise their franchise across 1,721 polling stations.

163.title: World's largest plane destroyed by Russian forces, claims Ukraine
163.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs has claimed that Russian forces have destroyed the world's largest plane, AN-225 'Mriya'. "They will never be able to destroy our dream of a strong, free and democratic European state. We shall prevail!" Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba tweeted. "We will rebuild the plane," the official Twitter handle of Ukraine wrote.

164.title: B'luru Police cover open city road, share before and after pics
164.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police took to Twitter to share before and after pictures of a city road after covering it up. "Officer and staff of station closed MES Outer Circular Road railway bridge near Jalahalli Traffic Police Station," police wrote. One Twitter user thanked police for "responsibility". "It is sad traffic police has to do this job," another wrote.

165.title: Why did India abstain from UNSC vote calling for General Assembly session on Ukraine?
165.article_body: Explaining its decision to abstain from UNSC procedural vote calling for an emergency General Assembly session on Ukraine situation, India said, "There is no other choice but to return to the path of diplomacy and dialogue." It added, "Our evacuation efforts have been adversely impacted by the complex and uncertain situation at border crossings."

166.title: Kept saying no to it, said yes for family; glad I signed it: Anil on 'Judaai'
166.article_body: As 'Judaai' clocked 25 years, actor Anil Kapoor said that he "kept saying no" to the film. "I could not connect with my character...I had a lot of pressure from family and the family production company as we were going through tough times financially...I am glad I said yes, as intention was to do it for the family," he added.

167.title: India abstains from UNSC vote calling for General Assembly session on Ukraine
167.article_body: India abstained from a procedural vote taken in UNSC to call for a special emergency session of UN General Assembly on Russia's aggression against Ukraine. China and UAE also abstained from the vote. Eleven UNSC members voted in favour of it, while Russia voted against it. Resolution was adopted as the vote was procedural and no member had a veto.

168.title: US urges its citizens to consider leaving Russia immediately
168.article_body: US' State Department on Sunday said that US citizens should consider leaving Russia immediately on commercial flights. It cited an increasing number of airlines cancelling flights and countries closing their airspace to Russia after Ukraine invasion. The State Department asked US citizens to have "a contingency plan that does not rely on US government assistance".

169.title: World's largest wealth fund to vote against Apple CEO's 2021 compensation
169.article_body: Norway's sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, will vote against ratification of Apple's management remuneration plan. The development comes after proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services urged investors to vote against Apple CEO Tim Cook's compensation of $98.7 million for 2021. Norges Bank Investment Management, which operates the wealth fund, said it would follow the advice.

170.title: Liverpool defeat Chelsea 11-10 on penalties to win League Cup for record 9th time
170.article_body: Liverpool defeated Chelsea 11-10 on penalties in the final at Wembley Stadium to win League Cup for a record ninth time. Chelsea goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga, who was brought on for penalty shoot-out in place of Edouard Mendy, was the only player from both the teams who missed a penalty. Chelsea finished as League Cup runners-up for the fourth time.

171.title: SIT will complete Anis Khan's death probe in 15 days: West Bengal DGP
171.article_body: Director-General of Police (West Bengal) Manoj Malviya on Sunday said that the Special Investigation Team's (SIT) probe into the death of student leader Anis Khan would be completed in 15 days. "We can't divulge any details as the case is monitored by Hon'ble High Court. But we will find the truth in the stipulated period," the DGP said.

172.title: Police help 80-yr-old patient in snowbound J&K area reach hospital
172.article_body: The police in J&K managed to save an 80-year-old critically ill patient after receiving a distress call from Karnah's forward Jabdi area on Sunday. The elderly man was in need of immediate medical attention but the road leading to the area was closed due to heavy snowfall. Police said their team arrived at the village and helped him reach hospital.

173.title: Turkish-made drones helping fight against Russia: Ukrainian envoy
173.article_body: The Ukrainian Ambassador to Turkey, Vasyl Bodnar, on Sunday said that the drones purchased from Turkey were very efficient in Ukraine's battle against the invading Russian forces. Turkey has sold several batches of Bayraktar TB2 drones to Ukraine. Earlier, Ukraine had deployed the drones against Russian-backed separatists in the country's eastern region.

174.title: Development of UP was never Akhilesh Yadav's priority: Yogi
